Panel formed to inspect hospitals.description: Madurai: The Madurai bench of the Madras high court has appointed a three-member committee to inspect the facilities available in government hospitals. Following the incident where three people allegedly died due to power disruption at the Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai, a batch of petitions was filed before the high court seeking to prevent such incidents by constituting a committee. When the petitions were taken up for hearing on Monday, a division bench of justice M Sathyanarayanan and justice B Pugalendhi formed the committee comprising two advocates and a doctor to inspect the facilities such as ventilators, UPS, process of blood transfusions at the government hospitals that comes under the jurisdiction of this court. NIA questions Madurai man, raids house.description: MADURAI: Close on the heels of the searches and arrests carried out in Coimbatore after busting an Islamic State-inspired terror module, sleuths from the National Investigation Agency (NIA) questioned a man in Madurai city on Saturday night. A search was also conducted at his house at Villapuram area. Though the 20-year-old was let off after hours of quizzing, he has been asked to present himself for further questioning whenever required. A team from Kochi led by a deputy superintendent of police conducted the operation. A city police source said the man was picked up around 9pm and taken to the special investigation cell office at Tallakulam for interrogation. The NIA team left the city after the overnight inquiry. NIA sources said that the man, who is studying in an Arabic college, was suspected to have propagated IS ideology. He was found to have shared and liked the posts of Zahran Hashim, the mastermind of the Sri Lanka Easter terror attack case, on social media. However, his name has been withheld by the agency. “His father was also questioned. Since they have not been arrested or any substantial evidence secured against them, their names cannot be divulged. However, they have been asked to appear before us for questioning if needed,” the source said. As reported, two people identified as Mohammed Azaruddin and Shiek Hidayuthuallah from Coimbatore, have been arrested by the NIA following the searches so far. It had registered a case against six people in connection with propagating IS ideology on social media to inspire youths to join the terrorist organization, sources said. MSU college to be shifted to a new build.description: Tirunelveli: The Manonmaniam Sundaranar University (MSU) College at Sankarankovil in Tirunelveli district will shift to a new temporary building from this academic year as the old building is in a dilapidated condition, according to officials. It may be recalled that only last month, a 19-year-old female student from the college died at the old campus after the parapet wall of the building collapsed due to heavy downpour. The old building where the incident happened was also a rented one. According to university officials, considering the safety of the students, they have decided to shift to a temporary building. “We have identified two buildings and we will quickly zero-in on one as soon as possible,” an official said. It may be recalled that the university administration had earlier mentioned that the construction of a new permanent building – at a cost of Rs 3.1crore – was fast-tracked so that the functioning could be shifted there by the beginning of the next academic year, but there has been a delay in the construction. “But the construction is going in full-swing and it should be finished within three months’ time. In the meantime, we will be functioning in the temporary building,” university vice-chancellor (VC) K Pitchumani told TOI. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Biker\u2019s death: kin, pillion rider c.description: MADURAI: Family members of a 38-year-old man, who fell down from his bike and died later in a hospital, petitioned the Madurai district administration with a charter of demands on Monday. The city police had said that the biker T Vivekanandakumar of S Alangulam and the pillion rider A Saravanakumar, fell down while attempting to flee from police who were conducting vehicle check. However, the family members and Saravanakumar claimed that they fell down after Vivekanandakumar was hit with a baton by a policeman. In their petition, the family members put forth various demands including a government job for the victim’s spouse, registration of murder case against the police constable responsible, Rs 25 lakh compensation and departmental action against the police personnel present at the spot. Relatives and family members of Vivekanandakumar thronged the collectorate in large numbers on Monday. Vivekanandakumar was on his way home from his tyre shop in Simmakkal along with his employee, Saravanakumar. The incident took place at MGR Bridge connecting Thaikkal Street and Sellur at 11.30pm on Saturday. Police officers said that both Vivekanandakumar and Saravanakumar were under the influence of alcohol and it was recorded in the records of the Government Rajaji Hospital, where they were sent for treatment. Madurai city deputy commissioner of police (law and order) V Sasi Mohan said that a preliminary inquiry has been conducted with the police team involved in the vehicle check. There was no eyewitness to the incident since it took place late at night. The CCTV footages collected from the spot are yet to be analyzed. The pillion rider is yet to be inquired by the police, he said. He said that they have to wait for the autopsy report for the details on cause of death. Meanwhile, an FIR has been registered in the Vilakkuthoon police station under IPC Sections 304 (a) – causing death by negligence and 279 – rash driving, Mohan said. \u2018We have separate tumbler at tea sh.description: MADURAI: Scheduled caste members from S Valayapatti village, who were attacked recently by those from the intermediate caste following simmering tensions, say they have been facing discrimination in various forms for many years now. They had to tolerate them as their elders, who were used to bearing with such discriminatory practices, did not allow them to bring them up before the outside world fearing backlash. The double tumbler system was prevalent in the village till a couple of months ago when people from the schedule caste used to go there. There were only two tea shops in the village, both run by members of intermediate caste. “While tea is served in tumblers made of stainless steel for them, we get it in use-and-throw cups. They stopped selling us tea in the last two months,” said C Ayyar, a village youth. Similarly, grocery shops too are run by people from the intermediate caste. There were about 400 families belonging to intermediate caste in the village as against about 50 families of schedule caste. Only a month ago, T Dhanalakshmi from the schedule caste opened a small shop. But it has not been easy for her to run the shop as those from intermediate caste who owned shops were creating trouble. “The distributor of a popular packaged milk sachet is not supplying me milk due to pressure from the owners of the other two shops. I have to travel 14 kms to reach Tirumangalam to buy milk,” Dhanalakshmi said. While the ration shop was functioning in a community hall near Muthalamman temple, members of the intermediate caste did not like SC members coming far into their settlement. As they opposed it, the library located nearby was turned into ration shop and supplies were distributed at separate timings. “Just two hours are allotted to us and that too after finishing supply to the intermediate caste families. Moreover, better quality supplies are reserved for them,” said A Periyakaruppi, a villager. Besides these, the scheduled caste members were not allowed to take bath in the public water tank meant for the purpose, said A Ravi, a youth. When they took up the issue, the officials said they will construct a separate one for them. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. HC dismisses forester\u2019s plea agains.description: MADURAI: The Madurai bench of Madras high court has dismissed the plea of a forester against the recovery order issued by the department for causing loss to the state exchequer in dealing with teak plantation. Petitioner K Karuppasamy joined as a forest watcher during 1986 and subsequently was promoted as forester in 1999. Following certain allegations concerning teak saplings, a charge memo was issued to the petitioner in October 2011 under Rule 17(a) of Tamil Nadu Civil Services (Discipline and Appeal) Rules. Though the petitioner denied the allegations, the conservator of forests, Madurai circle, passed an order imposing recovery for the loss incurred by the state exchequer. The counsel for the petitioner submitted that the loss occurred on account of natural calamities and therefore his client was not liable to compensate it. Justice S M Subramaniam observed that such natural calamities have not been established and there was no finding in this regard by the competent authority. He observed that in the departmental disciplinary proceedings, the explanation submitted by the delinquent alone is to be considered with regard to the records available and final orders to be passed by the competent authority. This being the procedure followed, the court is of the opinion that the findings arrived by the competent authority that there was financial loss to the state exchequer cannot now be re-adjudicated. Hence, the court stated that the petitioner was bound to pay the financial loss incurred by the state exchequer regarding the teak saplings and the arguments advanced by the counsel of the petitioner that the loss was due to natural calamities cannot be accepted. \u201840% oral cancer cases in south Asi.description: MADURAI: Around 1,200 dental students participated in the two-day state-level conference, which began in Madurai on Saturday, and oral cancer, due to its high prevalence in the country, was one of the most discussed topics on the day. Students from a total of 30 colleges from Tamil Nadu and Puducherry participated in the ‘Impact 2019: 2nd Tamil Nadu State Indian Dental Association (IDA) Student Conference’. Speaking to TOI, the organizers said that though an array of topics on dental trends were spoken about during the programme, oral cancer was given a particular focus not only because of its prevalence but also because of certain misconceptions surrounding it. Dr R Yoganandha, secretary of IDA Thirumangalam branch, who is a part of the organizing committee, in fact, said that their association was particular about intensifying and coming up with several awareness and sensitization programmes regarding oral cancer because “30% to 40% of overall oral cancer cases across the world were from south Asian countries including India, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.” “While people immediately approach doctors when a particular wound in finger or any other part does not heal for a long time, when it comes to oral ulcer, which does not get healed for a long time, most opt self-treatment and think it will heal on its own,” he said and added that in such instances, they should immediately consult a dentist as on some occasions, there could be a possibility of oral cancer as well. The experts also said that people should be very careful because “pain on many occasions could occur only at the advanced stages during oral cancer”. As for the reason of the higher prevalence of oral cancer in the country, doctors said it was because of the large number of people using various forms of tobacco and not only as cigarettes. Southern TN districts continue Nipah sur.description: MADURAI: The officials from Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli and Theni health departments have said that the intense surveillance and monitoring for Nipah infection would continue across the three districts for a few more days as a precautionary measure. They mentioned that though no suspected cases of the infection have been reported, they would still be on alert. The officials said that in the three districts, all the hospitals, including the private and government institutions – would be closely monitored to check the fever patients and if they had shown Nipah infection symptoms.Deputy director of health services (DDHS), Tirunelveli district, Dr S Senthil Kumar said that mobile camps were still stationed at the Tamil Nadu-Kerala border to monitor the passengers travelling between both the states. “The situation is completely in control and even in Kerala, it is the same. We are just extending the surveillance and monitoring for a few more days as a precautionary measure,” he added. In Theni district too, officials said that mobile camps have been planned at least for a fortnight in the three Tamil Nadu-Kerala check posts. “Apart from this, the regular awareness activities are also on,” an official said. Meanwhile, at Kanyakumari, the officials said that they suspended checking the passengers at the border of the two states, but were having a close eye at the migrant labourers travelling between both the states. “The fever surveillance is being carried out across 150 hospitals,” district deputy director of health services (DDHS) Dr M Madhusoodanan said. Students form human chain to spread awar.description: Madurai: As a part of observing the World Blood Donor Day (on June 15), the Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH) in Madurai conducted a blood donation drive apart from organizing a human chain to create awareness. In fact, as a part of observing the day, right from Thursday, several events ranging from sensitization talks to conducting mobile camps for blood donation drives were being organized by GRH and also by other individual organizations. On Friday, around 500 college and school students participated in a human chain from GRH to Indian Medical Association (IMA) to urge healthy volunteers to donate blood every three months. The officials from GRH also said that over the course of their campaigns across Thursday to Saturday, the main focus would also be on emphasizing on the point “safe blood for all”, which is the theme for World Blood Donor Day this year. “As a part of this, we gave sensitization talks to promote healthy voluntary repeat donors,” district blood transfusion officer Dr M Sintha said. The officials also said that despite enough awareness, there were repeated posts on social media and WhatsApp regarding urgent blood requirements for even the most common blood groups. “Such a situation would not arise even if 1% of the population donates blood,” the doctor added. Totally 25 people donated blood at the GRH camp on Friday. On Thursday, a camp was conducted at Joy Alukkas by Jeevanathi Trust and a total of 47 people donated blood and at Ahana Hospital, a camp was conducted by Young Indians. On Friday, another camp was conducted at Ahana Hospital by Young Indians in which 25 donors participated. Totally 20 donors donated blood in a camp which was conducted at the Ramani Motors. Will act tough against officials if disc.description: Departmental action will be taken against officials if found guilty in connection with the alleged discriminatory practices prevailing against scheduled caste people in S Valayapatti village who were attacked by members of an intermediate caste, said the vice-chairman of National Commission for Scheduled Castes L Murugan. The NCSC team visited S Valayapatti village along with officials from revenue and police department including district collector (in-charge) S Shantha Kumar on Saturday. When asked whether the transfer of two anganwadi workers belonging to scheduled caste based on pressure from intermediate caste members did not amount to encouraging discrimination, the vice-chairman said that was why he had issued showcause notice to the officials concerned. He had asked them to explain why legal action should not be initiated under the scheduled caste and scheduled tribe (prevention of atrocities) act against those responsible for shunting the anganwadi workers out of the village, he said. Murugan visited the affected people and took stock of the property damaged in the attack that took place on Sunday night. He insisted that the officials carry out speedy investigation and disburse compensation. Four people from scheduled castes had sustained injuries in the attack, which was the culmination point of the caste tension that has been prevailing there for about two years. The issue started flaring up once again in March when the people from scheduled caste were not allowed to worship in the village temple. While the intermediate caste people did not get approval for conducting jallikattu due to the tension, they turned the heat on the scheduled caste people. When they stopped water supply to SC people, the latter approached the local police. The police complaint fuelled the issue leading to the attack. Murugan said “I had sent a detailed circular to all district superintendents of police in the wake of Katchanathan attack case to identity vulnerable areas and provide counselling to people to pre-empt communal issues and asked them to take stringent action against those behind such attacks.” With the students belonging to intermediate caste not turning up at the school after the incident, the vice-chairman asked the officials to bring all the students back to the classroom from Monday onwards. He said that 11 accused in connection with the attack have been arrested so far, but the villagers wanted 28 more to be arrested. He said the police will form more teams and arrest all the suspects. The temple will be opened and officials will ensure that both communities worship without any dispute. The first installment of payment under SC/ST act to the victims will be disbursed on Monday, he said. Senior investigation officer from NCSC S Lister and district monitoring committee member B Pandiaraja also accompanied the vice-chairman. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

290kg of banned plastic seized.description: MADURAI: Officials from the Madurai Corporation seized 290kg of banned plastic materials from various parts of the city on Monday. As many as 558 shops were raided and a fine of Rs 51,800 was collected from the erring shop keepers. The crackdown created a buzz among the trading community as they stopped using plastic for the time being. The activists, who welcomed the crackdown, have urged the civic body to continue the initiative. The crackdown was conducted based on the instructions from the state government to take stringent action against offenders. Officials from Madurai Corporation said that similar searches were conducted throughout the state on Monday. A higher official of the corporation said that ward-level teams have been formed to take action against the offenders. Each team is led by sanitation and health inspectors. They are monitored by sanitation officials in the zonal level. While targets have been fixed for them, regular reports are sought to keep them on their toes, he said. House surgeons at TGMC allege sexual abu.description: Tuticorin: A group of final year women students who are on compulsory rotatory residential internship (CRRI) at the Thoothukudi Government Medical College (TGMC) in an unnamed complaint to the dean, have alleged sexual harassment by one of their assistant professors, who is also an orthopaedician and sought stringent action against him. According to the petition, seniors who have completed their course claimed that the doctor threatened them that they will not complete their MBBS degree if they did not heed to his ‘demands’. The petition also accused him of taking undue advantage of women attendants of patients, stalking the students, taking pictures and disturbing them through frequent calls and messages and taking the victims out with him. A copy of the petition was submitted to the college dean and superintendent of police of Tuticorin district. TGMC dean S Balasubramanian said a committee comprising three women doctors was formed to conduct an inquiry into these allegations. “We received the complaint a couple of days ago and formed the committee the same day,” he told TOI. “The committee conducted an inquiry with all the women house surgeons and the doctor who is facing the charges,” he said and added that the girls have given their version while the doctor has denied the allegations. The preliminary inquiry was completed on Friday and the report was sent to the DME the same day. “Action will be taken as recommended by the DME,” Balasubramanian added. Speaking to TOI, director of medical education (DME) A Edwin Joe said, “Severe departmental and legal action will be taken against the assistant professor if the sexual harassment charges against him are found to be true.” He said a probe has been ordered into the issue and is awaiting the report, based on which action would be taken. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. \u2018Introduce vehicles with desalinati.description: TUTICORIN: The BJP state president Tamilisai Soundararajan said that the government should take steps to resolve the drinking water crisis in the state by introducing vehicles with desalination plants like Israel. Tamilisai, along with her husband and son, conducted a medical camp at Kulasekaranallur in Tuticorin on Sunday, as several people were suffering from kidney related ailments. While addressing the media persons, Tamilisai said that Tamil Nadu is facing a huge drinking water crisis. She said that though the DMK and Congress are criticizing the state, such issue would not have arisen if they had implemented any long term scheme when they were in power. She said the state should take steps to resolve the drinking water crisis in the state by introducing vehicles with desalination plants like Israel. Former union minister Pon Radhakrishnan, responding to Congress MP S Thirunavukkarasar’s statement, said that he would sell his property to close the loans of farmers . Bountiful catch on day 1 to keep fishers.description: Madurai: All the 13 fishermen associations engaged in fishing from the Rameswaram harbour have decided to skip fishing on Monday due to the inability of exporters to accommodate the huge catch with which they returned to the shore on Sunday.With the 61-day fishing ban on the east coast ending on Friday, fishermen who went to sea returned with more than twice the usual catch they had before the ban. Though they were to go fishing from Saturday morning, a sizeable number of them went fishing on Friday afternoon. However, both groups returned on Sunday. “Against the normal catch of 200 kgs to 300 kgs per boat, it was 500 kg to 800 kg per boat today,” said a representative. “We expected good price for the hefty catch. But we were disappointed as our exporters could not buy it due to unavailability of ice, freezer boxes, vehicles and manpower to handle the huge quantity,” secretary of Rameswaram fishermen association N Devadoss told TOI.Hence the exporters said they would not be able to buy the catch for a day and requested the fishermen not to go fishing for a day. On the other hand, the fishermen said that exporters who bought a kilogram of export quality prawns (30 pieces per kg) for Rs 650 before the ban began had hinted that they would be able to pay only half the price, to the disappointment of fishermen. They hoped the price to pick up after Monday.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. HC quashes penalty order issued to ex-PI.description: Madurai: Observing that a notice was not served to the official before ordering penalty, the Madurai bench of Madras high court has quashed the penalty order issued to a retired public information officer (PIO). Petitioner T Pitchaiah was holding the post of PIO under Right to Information (RTI) Act in the Tiruvarur collectorate and had furnished certain information to an information seeker. Not satisfied with it, the information seeker approached the information commission to punish the petitioner. The directions issued by the commission were also not adhered to and in this regard, the counsel who appeared for the petitioner pointed out that a notice was received by the petitioner on December 8, 2008 asking him to appear on December 3, 2008 ! The counsel submitted that the successor of the petitioner who was holding the post of PIO failed to appear before the commission to produce the records. Thus, the petitioner cannot be blamed for the omission committed by his successor. The counsel further submitted that no notice or opportunity was given to the petitioner to be heard before being slapped the penalty and hence the penalty order issued in 2010 must be quashed. Justice S M Subramaniam observed that the court was of the considered opinion that no man should be punished unheard. “Statute provides that the central PIO or the state PIO as the case may be shall be given a reasonable opportunity of being heard before any penalty is imposed on him,” the judge said. Hence, the order of imposing penalty is not only improper but in violation to clause of Section 20 of RTI Act. The counsel who appeared for the petitioner brought to the notice of the court that the petitioner had already retired from service and now was a pensioner and therefore remanding the matter would not serve any purpose. The court noted that the additional government pleader was unable to establish that such a notice had already been provided to the petitioner before issuing the order of penalty. The court observed that this being the legal principle to be followed and the fact that the petitioner had already attained the age of superannuation and allowed to retire, no purpose would be served in remanding the matter now after a lapse of many years. Girls as camp coolies a bigger discrimin.description: MADURAI: Foeticide and infanticide are no more the worst forms of discrimination towards a girl child, according to an opinion survey conducted among women as well as men of 20 southern villages in the state. The rural lot, who took part in the sample survey on the challenges faced by girls and women, rated them as the least important of the issues in a list of 12. For them, the issue of top concern is the poor financial conditions forcing adolescent girls to work as camp coolies in spinning mills. This is followed by child marriage or early marriage. Women’s opinion getting ignored at home as well as in the community in decision making was rated as the third most important issue. The survey was conducted by five NGOs – Navajeevan Trust (NJT) Tirunelveli, NEEDS in Virudhunagar, People’s Action for Development (PAD) Ramanathapuram, Manushi in Pudukkottai – coordinated by Centre for Social Education and Development (CSED), Tirupur. Denial or lack of importance for higher education and lack of recognition for work done by women are among the more serious issues pointed out by the 3,368 people who took part in the survey in four southern districts. This is followed by physical, emotional, sexual and other forms of violence. While dowry-related issues such as postponement of marriages and broken marriages was voted 7th, disparity in wages, lack of recognition and exploitation of their labour were voted as the 6th issue of concern. Less attention to health care needs and suffering from anaemia and malnourishment is 8th. The NGOs conducted the opinion poll in Tirunelveli (774 people), Virudhunagar (980), Ramanathapuram (759) and Pudukottai (855) from May 10 to June 3. Listing out the various forms of discrimination and oppression faced by women and girls in a ballot paper, the villagers were asked to choose them based on a priority based on the seriousness in the order best known to them. To help them make their choice better, posters with pictorial representation of the 12 issues were displayed where the survey was conducted in those villages. They were asked to choose the top five serious issues from a list of 12. The folded sheets had to be deposited in a ballot box. Respondents were in the aged group of above 12 years and were divided into five age categories. As many as 2,196 (65.21%) people who took part in the opinion poll were girls and women, while the remaining 1,172 were men (34.79%). Most of the participants were in the age group of 25-40 years, followed by adults (24.64%) who were between 41 and 60 years of age. CSED executive director C Nambi said that the survey was aimed at bringing to light the partiality and violence faced by girls, adolescent women and women at home, education institutions, work place and in the society. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Theni SP among 10 personnel injured as p.description: Theni: Ten police personnel including the superintendent of police, V VBaskaran suffered injuries when a group of villagers, who were staging a road blockade, pelted stones on them while they tried to pacify the protesters. The incident took place in a village near Periyakulam on Friday night. Baskaran suffered an injury below his eye when a stone hit him. He was initially treated at the Theni Medical College Hospital, before being shifted to a private hospital in Madurai. He was later shifted to a private eye hospital. A doctor treating him said that it was a minor injury and there was no threat to his eyesight. “We have advised hospitalization for one more day just to ensure that he takes rest. We are treating him to reduce pain and swollen muscles,” said the doctor. Higher police officers including ADGP Jayanth Murali, Madurai city police commissioner S Davidson Devasirvatham and south zone IG K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran visited the injured SP in hospital. Meanwhile, the Thenkarai police have registered a case against a few people from Saruthupatti village, who took part in the protest. “An FIR has been registered. We have arrested five people so far and searching for a few more,” said inspector Mathana Kala. Around 400 police personnel have been deployed in the village and the suspects are being combed. Police said that it all began when a police constable identified as Siranjeevi attached to Devadhanapatti police station, and hailing from Saruthupatti village, claimed that he was attacked by some members of an intermediate caste from Lakshmipuram at Pomminayakkanpatti. This created tension and as a result the villagers staged a blockade on the Theni-Periyakulam road seeking the arrest of the ‘suspects’. “The police constable made a false claim to give a communal twist. Inquiry is underway to find out the reason. While there has been mounting tension between the two castes in the last three days, the villagers began a protest,” a police officer said. As traffic was affected on the road, SP Baskaran along with others arrived at the spot. After a while, when things went out of control and the protesters started pelting stones resulting in injuries to the police personnel. Police had to resort to a lathicharge after the stone pelting incident to disburse the crowd. Adequate strength has been deployed in all vulnerable areas and things are under control. There will not be any further escalation of tension, said deputy superintendent police, Periyakulam range, V Arumugam. Police sources said the tension between two castes in Periakulam region started on June 12, when a couple of youngsters from scheduled caste were questioned by members of the intermediate caste from Lakshmipuram for speeding through the street. While the duo left, they came back later and attacked those who questioned them. This led to people from Lakshmipuram stage a road blockade on June 13. They reportedly attacked a couple of students belonging to the scheduled caste from another village, when they were passing through the protest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two youths steal cash from hospital in T.description: MADURAI: The Kaliyakkavilai police are on the lookout for two youths who stole Rs 8,300 in cash and some medicines from the pharmacy of a private hospital at Padanthalumoodu in Kanyakumari district of Tamil Nadu. The theft happened in the pharmacy of Ravi Memorial Hospital around 6.40pm on Sunday. The theft came to light when a woman staff member in the pharmacy took stock of the collection of the day on Sunday night. She noticed a shortage of Rs 8,300 and reported it to the hospital management. Going through the CCTV footage recorded in the pharmacy, hospital authorities saw two youths stealing money from the cash box. The youths were seen asking for some medicines. When the pharmacist turned towards the racks of medicines, one of them opened the cash box and took some cash in a matter of a few seconds. The other person stole some medicines. They also bought some medicines, for which they paid and left the place. The hospital staff lodged a complaint with the Kaliyakkavilai police. The police said that faces of both the accused was clearly recorded on the cameras and that efforts were on to identify them. In Video:On cam: Youths steal cash from Kanyakumari hospitalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. In Video:Indian Army’s vehicle attacked by IED in J&K’s PulwamaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lankan with fake passport arrested.description: MADURAI: A 48-year-old Sri Lankan national was arrested at Madurai airport on Saturday minutes before boarding a flight to Sri Lanka on a fake passport. He had obtained the passport by forging documents to show as if he was an Indian national. The accused was identified as S Jeyakanthan, 48, a Sri Lankan Tamil native of Jaffna. While immigration police led by inspector Victor detained him, Jeyakanthan was later handed over to the Perungudi police. Preliminary inquiries revealed that Jeyakanthan, in Sri Lanka, had married a woman from Karaikudi in Sivaganga district in 2003. After living one month in Sri Lanka, he came to Tamil Nadu along with his wife on spouse visa. While Jeyankanthan overstayed in India, the couple shifted to Tuticorin, where he was involved in poultry business. With his Sri Lankan passport being expired, he obtained fake documents like Aadhar and driving license. He later obtained passport using the documents. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Non-essential services hit in hospitals.description: MADURAI: The health services across Madurai district took a hit on Monday since non-essential services were suspended at most of the private hospitals as around 2,200 doctors took part in the nationwide-strike called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) to condemn the assault on intern doctors in Kolkata. The doctors, apart from suspending non-essential services (predominantly the outpatient department services), also staged a demonstration at a few spots in Madurai. At the IMA office in Madurai, the doctors protested and said they would have a ‘zero tolerance to violence’ and also demanded strict implementation of laws to protect them from violent attacks. The doctors later protested at the auditorium of Madurai Medical College as well. At the Meenakshi Mission Hospital & Research Centre (MMHRC), more than 100 doctors and staff from the hospital and members attached to the Association of Healthcare Providers of India (AHPI-TN chapter) and IMA also staged a demonstration to show solidarity to the doctors on strike in Kolkata. Chairman of MMHRC, Madurai, and president of AHPI (TN chapter) Dr S Gurushankar said that the doctors in the city resorted to such protest due to the “continued suffering of resident doctors and repeated occurrence of violence against them without redressal”. “We strongly condemn the recent incident of violence against doctors in Kolkata by a frenzied mob. How can doctors function if they are fearful of their lives while treating patients? We need a strong nationwide law with stiff jail term to check violence against doctors. If need be, armed police personnel should be posted at hospitals to guard against physical assaults,” he added. Though the government institutions didn’t participate in the strike, several doctors at the Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH) wore a black badge showing their solidarity to the strike. Doctors across other southern districts also staged a widespread protest on the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." In Video:CM Mamata accepts proposal of doctors to set up Grievance Redressal CellDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. In Video:Kolkata: Magician drowns in Hooghly while attempting underwater Houdini escape actDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Residents, green activists protest again.description: MADURAI: Local residents and environmental activists have raised objection to the felling of trees in Kalavasal-Palanganatham street on the Bypass Road to make way for the flyover construction in the Kalavasal junction. The project, which was estimated to be completed at a cost of Rs 56, started being implemented in 2018. The protestors claimed that a few trees were already been cut and a few others pruned, with around 150 more now facing axe. A video clip on the environmental problem it can cause shot at Bypass Road has already viral on social media. The agitators said they did not see the permission letter obtained for felling trees despite calling for the same for long. They even prevented the contractor from going ahead with felling trees a couple of times in recent weeks asking them to produce permission letter. Sridhar Nedunchezhiyan, of Mannin Marangal Padhukappu Iyakkam, said that they are not up against development and road projects but demand the projects be carried out in such a way that minimize impact on the trees and environment. “Instead of cutting the trees, they can be replanted to nearby place. While thousands of trees are felled to give way for projects, its impact is on ecology and environment should be studied,” he said adding that already over 40 trees have been cut in Kalavasal-Guru Theatre strech alone. Adhis Che, an environmental activist, said that while crores of rupees are spent for projects, a few lakh rupees should be set aside for minimising environmental impact. “A city ideally should have 35% of tree cover, but the city like Madurai has far less tree cover. While we are already reeling under heat wave, things will worsen if the trees are felled,” he said. Divisional engineer of state highways, Sivaganga, M Mohanagandhi (in-charge Madurai division), said that no tree is directly affected by the project. Electrical posts and transformers needed to be shifted to give way for service roads on both sides of flyover. For this, some trees need to be cut. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Private buses resort to fleecing after s.description: Madurai: Thousands of passengers heading for Coimbatore, Tirupur and Salem had to pay a higher than usual fare for their Sunday night journey as private bus operators hiked the charge after seeing a sudden passenger surge in the hours. A state transport corporation (TNSTC) official said that the sudden surge was down to the India-Pakistan match that ended shortly before midnight as many waited for the match to end to start off their journey. “There was a sudden rush after the India–Pakistan World Cup match ended shortly before midnight. We tried our best to manage by operating additional buses,” said a TNSTC official in response to the heavy rush at the Arapalayam bus stand. Return of a large number of college students from the southern districts to colleges in the Coimbatore and Salem regions for the reopening of academic year added to the situation. Besides, who were lucky to get consecutive auspicious days for weddings, were going back to wort on the day. Passengers swarmed the bus stand and the approach roads in the hope of catching a government bus. To the dismay of passengers, there were not enough government buses for Coimbatore. “The number of government buses early on Monday was way lesser than on other days,” said passenger Premila,. The woman, who was heading for Coimbatore with two children, said that there was only one government bus to Tirupur around 1 am and no buses to Coimbatore at that time. “The bus to Tirupur was overcrowded and we could not get into it with the children and luggage,” said the woman. Due to the rush, many omni buses (long distance private buses) did not enter the city on Sunday night and in the early hours of Monday. These buses used to charge Rs 250 for a semi-sleeper and Rs 350 for an AC sleeper berth to Coimbatore. On Sunday, passengers without any other option had to pay Rs 400 for a seater in an ordinary private bus to Coimbatore. There were at least 10 such private buses waiting at that time. “We have to return without passengers. Hence, we are charging Rs 400,” said one of the operators. This left passengers lamenting, as they paid Rs 1,600 for a family of four as operators charged this fare for adults and children alike. “If there were enough TNSTC buses, we would have paid just Rs 510 at Rs 170 each for me and my wife and half the fare for the two children,” lamented a passenger. A TNSTC official in Madurai told ToI that they operated 26 additional buses to Coimbatore, 12, Tirupur, 11, and Salem, 3, on Sunday night and that this was in addition to additional buses operated by the Coimbatore, 20, and the Salem divisions of TNSTC. Madurai division also operated around 20 additional buses Madurai and Virudhunagar to Chennai due to the heavy rush, he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Youth attacked in clash succumbs to inju.description: Madurai: A 22-year-old youth, who suffered injuries in an attack by a 15-member group, died in a hospital on Monday. Three more people who were injured in the incident that took place on Sunday, are undergoing treatment in hospital. The deceased was identified as S Rambu of A Kovilpatti village near Nathapatti in Madurai district. The injured were identified as P Subash, 19, and P Thangaiah, 30, from Kodukkampatti, R Dhivakar, 19, from Kachirayanpatti. While the deceased and injured belong to an intermediate caste, the attackers hailed from a scheduled caste community. Police sources said that both the accused and the injured were under the influence of alcohol. The attack took place on Sunday afternoon at Kodukkampatti due to a sudden provocation between the two groups. Rambu and his friends visited Kodukkampatti village, where his relatives reside, to attend a temple festival. They went to a shop located in the scheduled caste people’s residential area. As they sped through the locality on a two-wheeler, a group of people from the scheduled caste community warned them against rash riding in their area. This resulted in a heated argument. A group of around 15 people the attacked the four using wooden logs and stones, which left them badly injured. Rambu, who suffered grievous injuries, was first taken to a hospital in Singampunari, from where he was referred to the Government Rajaji Hospital, where he died on Monday. The relatives of the victim and the injured staged a protest at Panagal Road in front of the GRH. While an autopsy was conducted, the relatives refused to receive the body. Meanwhile, the Keelavalavu police registered a case under various sections of the IPC including 302- punishment for murder. While 15 people including 10 unnamed have been booked, M Ravichandran, 19, B Kalyanasundaram, 27, Natchiappan,34, T Thirumavalavan and K Kalanjiyam from Kodukkampatti have been picked up for inquiry. A large posse of police have been deployed in villages around Melur to prevent caste-based clash and reduce tension in the village, where the incident took place. South Zone IG K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran and deputy inspector general of police (Madurai range) Pradip Kumar visited the village and took stock of situation. Madurai district superintendent of police was camped at Melur. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Vaiko alleges irregularities in admissio.description: MADURAI: MDMK general secretary Vaiko on Sunday came up with allegations that there were irregularities in admission procedure for the upcoming academic year at Madurai Kamaraj University (MKU). In a statement, the MDMK chief alleged lack of transparency in the admissions, adding a probe should be carried out into the “irregularity”. The admission process for postgraduate courses was carried out in three phases this year: while in the first phase it was for courses which didn’t require any entrance examination, the second was for courses for which admission was done based on the state-level entrance test and the third was for those for which national-level entrance was held. According to Vaiko, when it came to the entrance examinations, the results were never declared and even for the admission procedure, the ranking or merit list was not disclosed in proper manner. Further, he claimed that for counselling, which was held on May 13, the communication for the candidates was sent only by May 10 that too via post and as one of the two days in between was a holiday (Sunday), the information didn’t reach the candidates on time. “The communication didn’t even reach many and hence only a few students participated in the counselling on Monday,” he added. Vaiko went on to allege that to hide the “mistakes” and “irregularities”, MKU suddenly removed all the admission related announcements and details from the website. He urged that the government should take “action against those who were responsible for the irregularities” However, MKU administration on the other hand dismissed all the allegations. It may be recalled that it was only this year, MKU opted for counselling process for admissions and the university vice-chancellor (VC) M Krishnan said that it was introduced only to make the procedure “more transparent”. He added that the transparency was in fact praised by the parents of the candidates this year. “We had not released the merit list online, but on the day of counselling, for all subjects, it was displayed for all the participants in the large screen at our auditorium. When it comes to issuing the results of entrance test, it is not required because we give the merit list. Everything was done as per procedure,” Krishnan said.
